page.title: 03MINING
page.content: Our dads work down the mine. They work at Clipstone Pit and Mansfield Colliery. Our dads go on three shifts, they are days, nights and afters. Sometimes our dads go in the car or go on the bus to the pit. They are off on Saturdays and Sundays and they get their wages on Friday. Many people work at the pit. There are about 1,000 people. They go down about 2,150 feet under ground. They go down in a chair which takes about 65 people. When they are down there are different routes to go. They use all sorts of tools. There are sometimes diggers, explosives and machines. When there is a gas leak my dad goes down the tunnel to see where the gas is coming from. The coal that they dig up goes to the power station to make electricity. {NATALIE WOODS, JOANNE HEIGHWAY
